--- title: "Dataset Project" description: "Analysing a spcific dataset of my choosing" image: images/illustration-of-a-hare-at-a-keyboard-vector-sticker-of-a-white-cute-cartoon-rabbit-hacker-meme-sticker-rodent-animal-hits-the-keyboard-2WD8316.jpg author: - name: Brenda Cruz affiliation: University of California, Davis date: 10-24-2024 format: html: page-layout: article grid: margin-width: 350px code-fold: true code-summary: "Show the code" categories: [MyProjects, R, Bioinformatics] draft: false # setting this to `true` will prevent your post from appearing on your listing page until you're ready! title-block-banner: true css: style.css --- # Healthcare Insurance Data set For my project, I decided to explore healthcare insurance data sets because I'm interested in understanding how medical conditions influence healthcare costs. ## What condition was billed the most? The pie chart below shows that **diabetes** was one of the most billed conditions at 16.8% of the total billing amount. A total amount billed of 2.385397e+08. [Additionally, the person with the highest bill was **Karen Kline**.
She was billed a total 104746.064748 by United Healthcare in the span of **14** days]{.aside} ::: {#c139fdab .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=447 height=409} ::: ::: ::: {#ee7f0497 .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name kARen klInE 104746.064748 Name: Billing Amount, dtype: float64 ``` ::: ::: I decided to understand how diabetes was being treated and how it would affect the cost. The table below shows that the number one insurance provider for people with Diabetes was Medicare with 1730 patients total. Additionally Medicare had the highest amount billed which could be due to the the fact that they had more patients. ::: {#e56a7d5b .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} diabetes = df[df['Medical Condition'] == 'Diabetes'] df_unique = diabetes.drop_duplicates(subset='Name', keep='first') insurance = df_unique['Insurance Provider'].value_counts() print(insurance) costly = df.groupby(df_unique['Insurance Provider'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Insurance Provider Medicare 1730 Blue Cross 1683 Cigna 1679 Aetna 1668 UnitedHealthcare 1624 Name: count, dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: ## Diabetes in the healthcare database Lipitor was the drug most likely prescribed to someone with diabetes. A reason for this is that people with diabetes are twice as likely to have **heart disease** or a stroke compared to people without diabetes. Medications such as Lipitor are effective at lowering low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol lowering the chances of a stroke. ::: {#951603cd .cell .column-margin execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} medication = diabetes['Medication'].value_counts() plt.figure(figsize=(1, 1)) plt.bar(medication.index, medication.values) plt.xlabel('Medication') plt.ylabel('Frequency') plt.title('Frequency of Medications') plt.xticks(rotation=90) plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-7-output-1.png){width=223 height=224} ::: ::: ::: {#b2d27df8 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} costmed = df.groupby(diabetes['Medication'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(5) newdf = diabetes[['Medication', 'Insurance Provider', 'Billing Amount']] medication_billing = newdf.groupby(['Insurance Provider', 'Medication'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(8).reset_index() print(medication_billing) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Insurance Provider Medication Billing Amount 0 Medicare Aspirin 1.076458e+07 1 Cigna Lipitor 1.039165e+07 2 Aetna Paracetamol 1.014584e+07 3 Aetna Penicillin 9.897654e+06 4 Cigna Penicillin 9.862867e+06 5 Blue Cross Ibuprofen 9.843164e+06 6 Blue Cross Lipitor 9.768164e+06 7 Medicare Paracetamol 9.748423e+06 ``` ::: ::: Liptor had second largest billed amount for medication under the insurance Cigna. In spite of Cigna having the third largest number of patients it was gaining the most amount of money by providing the Lipitor medication. Cigna was providing Lipitor medication at a higher amount than other insrance providers. ::: {#3322ea90 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} cigna = diabetes[diabetes['Insurance Provider'] == 'Cigna'] med_admission = cigna.groupby('Medical Condition')['Admission Type'].value_counts() plt.pie(med_admission, labels=med_admission.index, autopct='%1.1f%%') plt.title('Admission Types by Medical Condition') plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-9-output-1.png){width=582 height=409} ::: :::
